title: Creamy Garlic Pasta Recipe
description: Looking for creamy pasta recipes? Look no further. This is the best, with garlic, cream, and Parmesan cheese — a dish that is easy and delicious.

About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Recipes Main Dishes Pasta Spaghetti Creamy Garlic Pasta 4.8 (347) 308 Reviews 39 Photos As far as creamy pasta recipes, this is the best I have ever had. Add prawns and/or scallops to make an amazing seafood Alfredo. Submitted by Celestial Updated on April 22, 2024 Save Rate Print Share Add Photo 39 39 39 39 Prep Time: 10 mins Cook Time: 20 mins Total Time: 30 mins Servings: 4 Jump to Nutrition Facts Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 4 servings 2 teaspoons olive oil 4 garlic cloves, minced 2 tablespoons butter 3 cups chicken broth, or more as needed ½ teaspoon ground black pepper ¼ teaspoon salt ½ pound spaghetti 1 cup grated Parmesan cheese ¾ cup heavy cream 1 ½ tablespoons dried parsley Directions Gather all ingredients. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Heat olive oil in a medium pan over medium heat. Add garlic and stir until fragrant, 1 to 2 minutes. Add butter and stir constantly until melted. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Pour in 3 cups chicken broth; add pepper and salt. Bring to a boil. Add spaghetti and cook, stirring occasionally, until tender yet firm to the bite, about 12 minutes. Add more chicken broth if pasta starts to stick to the pan. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Add Parmesan cheese, cream, and parsley and mix until thoroughly combined. Serve immediately. Add Your Photo Photos of Creamy Garlic Pasta 01 of 39 Photo by  Dotdash Meredith Food Studios 02 of 39 Photo by  FrackFamily5 CACT 04/14/2025 A keeper! I doubled the recipe and it was delicious! It was a hit. Easy and delicious- win-win. 03 of 39 Photo by  Chef Potpie 03/31/2025 This recipe worked very well for me, and I will make it again. I didn't have a problem with the sauce being "watery," as some reviewers have said. Perhaps they didn't use heavy cream? Mine turned out just perfect, a wonderful side dish, however I made it for a comfort meal for just myself this time. I added a squeeze of fresh lemon juice and toasted breadcrumbs on top. It was delicious and comfort food at it's best! Thank you for sharing this simple keeper recipe! 04 of 39 Photo by  Allrecipes Member 03/10/2025 OK with tweaks Real good recipe for cream pasta. I did add more garlic, broth and italian chicken meatballs. I would make again. 05 of 39 Photo by  Alana Voeks 03/03/2025 A keeper! Great flavors Easy to follow Worth the effort Family favorite This was delicious! I add power greens to stuff like this to make it a little healthier, I sautéed some mushrooms beforehand too. While the noodles were cooking (which I used rotini instead), I added in some oregano and thyme too, and lots more pepper than what it called for. I added extra garlic too, as we love it! When adding in the cheese (which we did some wine cheese and pecorino with the parmesan), I added a touch of lemon powder and some cayenne too. Cuts through the richness without losing any flavor! Added some breaded chicken on top too, added to the fullness of it! When adding the chicken stock to the pan, I included some chicken bouillon too, makes the flavor more pronounced! 06 of 39 Photo by  GoldenPeas1949 02/03/2025 Great flavors A keeper! Easy to follow Worth the effort Crowd-pleaser Family favorite It was amazing! The only thing I did different was at chicken, and ooo this was an amazing meal. Definitely recommend, definitely will cook again! 07 of 39 Photo by  MSEPERAS 01/28/2025 Great flavors A keeper! This was a super simple recipe. I only had chicken stock, so I used that instead of broth. I also fried up meatballs first in the pan. Then sautéed the garlic in the grease from the meatballs. I feel like this gave the pasta sauce a more rich flavor. The pasta used was bucatini. It’s far better than regular spaghetti. 08 of 39 Photo by  Tracy Terralavoro 09/11/2024 This was a hit!! Both my boys LOVED it as did I. I did double the recipe so I used a sauce pot, I used whole wheat pasta and add a bunch of broccoli (Which I steamed beforehand and put in at the end with the cream, parm cheese & parsley) and put in a lot more garlic as were garlic lovers in this house. Is one of our new favorites 🤩! 09 of 39 Photo by  Marco Mcdonald 08/24/2024 Family favorite Recipe is great I just added 1 can of rotel and fresh parsley and doubled the recipe.
